definition: workplace/workforce (of a nation or industry etc)/job market
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: I was baffled that some ofthe most basic workplace blunders seem to be tripping people up!
sentences.chinese: 許多最基本的職場失誤會讓他們摔跟頭，這讓我困惑。

sentences.english: The decline in breastfeeding has become a major concern to health workers.
sentences.chinese: 母乳哺餵率下降之關注議題已經考量到職場員工。

sentences.english: Form the habit of recording your daily deeds in workplaces.
sentences.chinese: 養成每天記錄自己職場行爲的習慣。

sentences.english: The career principles in the books are also of limited use.
sentences.chinese: 此外，書中所說的職場原則也鮮少有用武之地。

sentences.english: None of which is good when you're fighting to stay afloat in a competitive work environment.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是在激烈的職場競爭環境中的生存大忌。

sentences.english: A woman who has recently re-entered the workforce should make sure she's maxing out her own retirement accounts.
sentences.chinese: 近期再入職場的女性應確保其存有足夠的退休金。

sentences.english: Handsome men are always at an advantage and never discriminated against.
sentences.chinese: 英俊的男士永遠佔有優勢，且從不遭受職場白眼。

sentences.english: Workplace friendships are like a double-edged sword.
sentences.chinese: 職場友誼就像一把雙刃劍。

sentences.english: Everyone knows that attitudes toward work attire have relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 都知道，人們對職場裝束的態度變得隨意了。

sentences.english: There's a lot of bravura in business about how little people sleep.
sentences.chinese: 關於職場人士犧牲睡眠的壯舉有很多，我並不認同。

sentences.english: I will think naught of my family when I am in the market place for this will cloud my thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 身在職場，不可戀家，否則那會使我思想混飩。

sentences.english: In the turbulent, toss-about world of work, all kinds of people are worried about getting fired.
sentences.chinese: 在風雲變幻的職場中，每個人都在擔心會不會被炒。

sentences.english: You can try to use following methods to solve the contradictories in work.
sentences.chinese: 妳可以試著利用下面的方法來解決職場矛盾。

sentences.english: Like it or not, the multi-generational workplace is here.
sentences.chinese: 不管你喜歡與否，現在的職場就是多代共事的。

sentences.english: Smart careerists are always ready for the next opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 聰明的職場人士隨時準備好迎接下一個機會。

sentences.english: Hypomanics and manics generally have chaotic personal and professional relationships.
sentences.chinese: 輕度躁狂和躁狂患者的人際及職場關係，通常一團糟。

definition: to be employed/to be in post/on-the-job
undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to begin an undertaking/to start a major task/to initiate/to venture/venture/entrepreneurship
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
every trade/all professions/all walks of life
